DataElement.preferredName: Image Series Synchronization Frame of Reference Unique Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A set of equipment may share a common acquisition synchronization environment, which is identified by a Synchronization Frame of Reference UID. All SOP Instances that share the same Synchronization Frame of Reference UID shall be temporally related to each other. If a Synchronization Frame of Reference UID is present, all SOP Instances in the Series must share the same Frame of Reference.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Image Series Synchronization Frame of Reference Identity Unique Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A set of equipment may share a common acquisition synchronization environment, which is identified by a Synchronization Frame of Reference UID. All SOP Instances that share the same Synchronization Frame of Reference UID shall be temporally related to each other. If a Synchronization Frame of Reference UID is present, all SOP Instances in the Series must share the same Frame of Reference.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.:A number of things or events standing or succeeding in order, and connected by a like relation. (from On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.
A group or succession of objects, substances, or events arranged in regular order in space or time, connected by a like relation, or forming a kind of chain.

Property.preferredName: Synchronization Frame of Reference Identity Unique Identifier
Property.preferredDefinition: An adjustment that causes something to occur or recur in unison.:There is a defined equivalence between the Frame of Reference of the Registration SOP instance and the Frame of Reference of the referenced images.:The single one of its kind.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: Occurring at the same time or rate.
There is a defined equivalence between the Frame of Reference of the Registration SOP instance and the Frame of Reference of the referenced images.
The single one of its kind.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Unique identifier for an object or person.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
